Package javanews.events.gui

Provides classes for responding to user-driven events from the GUI.

See:
          Description

Class Summary
Client_LnF This class is responsible for updating the Look and Feel of the application according to the user's selection.
Client_LogDir This class is responsible for handling events where the user wants to change the directory used to store log files.
Client_Logging This class is responsible for altering the level at which all loggers record events within the application.
Client_MinimiseAll This class is responsible for iterating through all internal frames shown within the JDesktopPane and minimising each of them.
Client_SetDatabase This class is used to handle events where the user wants to change the data source name of the back-end database for the application.
Client_ShowComConfig This class is used to listen for events from the parent JMenuItem.
Client_ShowThreads This class is responsible for displaying a window with a list of active threads monitoring COM ports within the application and their status.
Client_TileWindow This class is used to tile all internal frames within the DesktopPane.
CloseComPortClient This class handles any request to close a COM Port Client window.
CloseJavaNews This class handles any request to close the JavaNews application.
CloseLinkChart This class is responsible for handling events generated and related to the closure of an instance of LinkChart which displays a set of dynamically updated charts for links used within the application.
CloseRawDataWindow This class is responsible for reacting to the user closing instances of the RawDataWindow class.
COMConfig_Save This class is responsible for writing data to the preferences file and initiating new threads to monitor COM ports based on user selections in the COM Port Configuration window.
COMPortClient_Save This class is responsible for responding to user events generated by clicking on the Save As button in the COMPortClient window.
COMPortClient_ShowCharts This class is used to respond to events generated when the user clicks on a menu-bar item within the COMPortClient window requiring a chart to be displayed.
COMPortClient_ShowRawData This class is used to respond to events generated when the user clicks on the Show Raw Data menu-bar item within the COMPortClient window.
GenericFrame_Export This class is responsible for exporting data from a GenericFrame class.
HelpMenu Listens for events corresponding to any of the three items in the Help menu.
URLClickListener Used to detect the user attempting to navigate through HTML links embedded within any HTML content displayed within a JEditorPane.
 

Package javanews.events.gui Description

Provides classes for responding to user-driven events from the GUI. Most of the classes relate to items within menus displayed within the GUI and the events generated from them. There are also classes relating to window events to ensure that the application runs correctly and objects are closed and threads terminated correctly. There is also a class listening for events generated from HTTP activities (the help windows use HTML code to provide links to other resources).

Package Specification

None
